poem:
**Part of the Whole**

In the quiet orbit of morning,  
a song echoes without his voice—  
Dave who carried melodies  
like gentle whispers through the trees,  
now laid down among the roots.

A union of notes and silence,  
his music drifts—  
the unseen guide of countless journeys,  
forever a part  
of the melody's timeless fabric.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dave Cousins obituary The one song by the Strawbs most likely to feature in pop quizzes is Part of the Union, the rowdy working man’s singalong that reached No 2 on the British singles chart in 1973. Yet, written by band members Richard Hudson and John Ford, it could hardly have been less typical of the output of Dave Cousins, the band’s founder and mainstay. Cousins, who has died aged 85, piloted the group through countless". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
